result.execSummary:
The defendant Brenda L Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Apply 63 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution ($28) - PAID IN FULL.  To be paid to the Crime Victim's Compensation Fund.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Anger Management and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brenda L Adams in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  

State presented their setencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
63 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.


Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION:  $28 (to be paid to the Crime Victim's Compensation Fund);
Apply Bail TO RESTITUTION ONLY and refund the balance to the posting party.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agent's discretion.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
Sentencing hearing on May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brenda L Adams in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.
State has not complied with victim notification.
Therefore, we can do a plea today and put matter over sentencing.

State filed an Amended Information.
Defense acknowleges receipt of the amended information and waives reading.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed and read in.

State objects and presented arguments.
